auth.description: API token or basic auth username:password. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_AUTH` environment variable.

ca_cert.description: Certificate CA bundle to use to verify the Grafana server's certificate. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_CA_CERT` environment variable.

cloud_api_key.description: API key for Grafana Cloud. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_CLOUD_API_KEY` environment variable.

cloud_api_url.description: Grafana Cloud's API URL. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_CLOUD_API_URL` environment variable.

http_headers.description: Optional. HTTP headers mapping keys to values used for accessing the Grafana API. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_HTTP_HEADERS` environment variable in JSON format.

insecure_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate verification. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_INSECURE_SKIP_VERIFY` environment variable.

org_id.description: The organization id to operate on within grafana. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_ORG_ID` environment variable.

retries.description: The amount of retries to use for Grafana API calls. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_RETRIES` environment variable.

sm_access_token.description: A Synthetic Monitoring access token. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_SM_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable.

sm_url.description: Synthetic monitoring backend address. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_SM_URL` environment variable.

store_dashboard_sha256.description: Set to true if you want to save only the sha256sum instead of complete dashboard model JSON in the tfstate.

tls_cert.description: Client TLS certificate file to use to authenticate to the Grafana server. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_TLS_CERT` environment variable.

tls_key.description: Client TLS key file to use to authenticate to the Grafana server. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_TLS_KEY` environment variable.

url.description: The root URL of a Grafana server. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_URL` environment variable.

disable_resolve_message.description: Whether to disable sending resolve messages. Defaults to `false`.

frequency.description: Frequency of alert reminders. Frequency must be set if reminders are enabled. Defaults to ``.

is_default.description: Is this the default channel for all your alerts. Defaults to `false`.

name.description: The name of the alert notification channel.

secure_settings.description: Additional secure settings, for full reference lookup [Grafana Supported Settings documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/administration/provisioning/#supported-settings).

send_reminder.description: Whether to send reminders for triggered alerts. Defaults to `false`.

settings.description: Additional settings, for full reference see [Grafana HTTP API documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/http_api/alerting_notification_channels/).

type.description: The type of the alert notification channel.

uid.description: Unique identifier. If unset, this will be automatically generated.

cloud_stack_slug.description: If set, the API key will be created for the given Cloud stack. This can be used to bootstrap a management API key for a new stack. **Note**: This requires a cloud token to be configured.

builtin_role.description: Organization roles (`Viewer`, `Editor`, `Admin`) or `Grafana Admin` to assign the roles to.

global.description: States whether the assignment is available across all organizations or not. Defaults to `false`.

uid.description: Unique identifier of the role to assign to `builtin_role`.

block.description: Fixed or custom roles which provide granular access for specific resources within Grafana.

**Note:** This resource is available only with Grafana Enterprise 8.+.

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/enterprise/access-control/)
* [HTTP API](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/http_api/access_control/)

cloud_org_slug.description: The slug of the organization to create the API key in. This is the same slug as the organization name in the URL.

role.description: Role of the API key. Should be one of [Viewer Editor Admin MetricsPublisher PluginPublisher]. See https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/api/#create-api-key for details.

block.description:
Manages a single API key on the Grafana Cloud portal (on the organization level)
* [API documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/reference/cloud-api/#api-keys)

alertmanager_name.description: Name of the Alertmanager instance configured for this stack.

alertmanager_status.description: Status of the Alertmanager instance configured for this stack.

alertmanager_url.description: Base URL of the Alertmanager instance configured for this stack.

alertmanager_user_id.description: User ID of the Alertmanager instance configured for this stack.

id.description: The stack id assigned to this stack by Grafana.

name.description: Name of stack. Conventionally matches the url of the instance (e.g. “<stack_slug>.grafana.net”).

org_id.description: Organization id to assign to this stack.

org_name.description: Organization name to assign to this stack.

org_slug.description: Organization slug to assign to this stack.

prometheus_remote_endpoint.description: Use this URL to query hosted metrics data e.g. Prometheus data source in Grafana

prometheus_remote_write_endpoint.description: Use this URL to send prometheus metrics to Grafana cloud

prometheus_user_id.description: Promehteus user ID. Used for e.g. remote_write.

region_slug.description:
Region slug to assign to this stack.
Changing region will destroy the existing stack and create a new one in the desired region

slug.description:
Subdomain that the Grafana instance will be available at (i.e. setting slug to “<stack_slug>” will make the instance
available at “https://<stack_slug>.grafana.net".

url.description: Custom URL for the Grafana instance. Must have a CNAME setup to point to `.grafana.net` before creating the stack

wait_for_readiness.description: Whether to wait for readiness of the stack after creating it. The check is a HEAD request to the stack URL (Grafana instance). Defaults to `true`.

dashboard_id.description: The numeric ID of the dashboard computed by Grafana.

folder.description: The id of the folder to save the dashboard in.

message.description: Set a commit message for the version history.

overwrite.description: Set to true if you want to overwrite existing dashboard with newer version, same dashboard title in folder or same dashboard uid.

slug.description: URL friendly version of the dashboard title. This field is deprecated, please use `uid` instead.

uid.description: The unique identifier of a dashboard. This is used to construct its URL. It’s automatically generated if not provided when creating a dashboard. The uid allows having consistent URLs for accessing dashboards and when syncing dashboards between multiple Grafana installs.

version.description: Whenever you save a version of your dashboard, a copy of that version is saved so that previous versions of your dashboard are not lost.

dashboard_id.description: ID of the dashboard to apply permissions to.

permission.description: Permission to associate with item. Must be one of `View`, `Edit`, or `Admin`.

team_id.description: ID of the team to manage permissions for. Defaults to `0`.

user_id.description: ID of the user to manage permissions for. Defaults to `0`.

block.description: The permission items to add/update. Items that are omitted from the list will be removed.

access_mode.description: The method by which Grafana will access the data source: `proxy` or `direct`. Defaults to `proxy`.

basic_auth_enabled.description: Whether to enable basic auth for the data source. Defaults to `false`.

database_name.description: (Required by some data source types) The name of the database to use on the selected data source server. Defaults to ``.

is_default.description: Whether to set the data source as default. This should only be `true` to a single data source. Defaults to `false`.

name.description: A unique name for the data source.

password.description: (Required by some data source types) The password to use to authenticate to the data source. Defaults to ``.

type.description: The data source type. Must be one of the supported data source keywords.

uid.description: Unique identifier. If unset, this will be automatically generated.

url.description: The URL for the data source. The type of URL required varies depending on the chosen data source type.

username.description: (Required by some data source types) The username to use to authenticate to the data source. Defaults to ``.

assume_role_arn.description: (CloudWatch, Athena) The ARN of the role to be assumed by Grafana when using the CloudWatch or Athena data source.

auth_type.description: (CloudWatch, Athena) The authentication type used to access the data source.

conn_max_lifetime.description: (MySQL, PostgreSQL, and MSSQL) Maximum amount of time in seconds a connection may be reused (Grafana v5.4+).

custom_metrics_namespaces.description: (CloudWatch) A comma-separated list of custom namespaces to be queried by the CloudWatch data source.

database.description: (Athena) Name of the database within the catalog.

default_bucket.description: (InfluxDB) The default bucket for the data source.

default_project.description: (Stackdriver) The default project for the data source.

default_region.description: (CloudWatch, Athena) The default region for the data source.

external_id.description: (CloudWatch, Athena) If you are assuming a role in another account, that has been created with an external ID, specify the external ID here.

http_method.description: (Prometheus) HTTP method to use for making requests.

interval.description: (Elasticsearch) Index date time format. nil(No Pattern), 'Hourly', 'Daily', 'Weekly', 'Monthly' or 'Yearly'.

log_level_field.description: (Elasticsearch) Which field should be used to indicate the priority of the log message.

log_message_field.description: (Elasticsearch) Which field should be used as the log message.

max_concurrent_shard_requests.description: (Elasticsearch) Maximum number of concurrent shard requests.

max_idle_conns.description: (MySQL, PostgreSQL and MSSQL) Maximum number of connections in the idle connection pool (Grafana v5.4+).

max_lines.description: (Loki) Upper limit for the number of log lines returned by Loki

max_open_conns.description: (MySQL, PostgreSQL and MSSQL) Maximum number of open connections to the database (Grafana v5.4+).

organization.description: (InfluxDB) An organization is a workspace for a group of users. All dashboards, tasks, buckets, members, etc., belong to an organization.

output_location.description: (Athena) AWS S3 bucket to store execution outputs. If not specified, the default query result location from the Workgroup configuration will be used.

postgres_version.description: (PostgreSQL) Postgres version as a number (903/904/905/906/1000) meaning v9.3, v9.4, etc.

profile.description: (CloudWatch, Athena) The credentials profile name to use when authentication type is set as 'Credentials file'.

query_timeout.description: (Prometheus) Timeout for queries made to the Prometheus data source in seconds.

sigv4_assume_role_arn.description: (Elasticsearch and Prometheus) Specifies the ARN of an IAM role to assume.

sigv4_auth.description: (Elasticsearch and Prometheus) Enable usage of SigV4.

sigv4_auth_type.description: (Elasticsearch and Prometheus) The Sigv4 authentication provider to use: 'default', 'credentials' or 'keys' (AMG: 'workspace-iam-role').

sigv4_external_id.description: (Elasticsearch and Prometheus) When assuming a role in another account use this external ID.

sigv4_profile.description: (Elasticsearch and Prometheus) Credentials profile name, leave blank for default.

sigv4_region.description: (Elasticsearch and Prometheus) AWS region to use for Sigv4.

time_field.description: (Elasticsearch) Which field that should be used as timestamp.

time_interval.description: (Prometheus, Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and MSSQL) Lowest interval/step value that should be used for this data source.

tls_auth.description: (All) Enable TLS authentication using client cert configured in secure json data.

tls_auth_with_ca_cert.description: (All) Enable TLS authentication using CA cert.

tls_configuration_method.description: (All) SSL Certificate configuration, either by ‘file-path’ or ‘file-content’.

tls_skip_verify.description: (All) Controls whether a client verifies the server’s certificate chain and host name.

token_uri.description: (Stackdriver) The token URI used, provided in the service account key.

access_key.description: (CloudWatch, Athena) The access key to use to access the data source.

access_token.description: (Github) The access token to use to access the data source

basic_auth_password.description: (All) Password to use for basic authentication.

private_key.description: (Stackdriver) The service account key `private_key` to use to access the data source.

secret_key.description: (CloudWatch, Athena) The secret key to use to access the data source.

sigv4_access_key.description: (Elasticsearch and Prometheus) SigV4 access key. Required when using 'keys' auth provider.

sigv4_secret_key.description: (Elasticsearch and Prometheus) SigV4 secret key. Required when using 'keys' auth provider.

tls_ca_cert.description: (All) CA cert for out going requests.

tls_client_cert.description: (All) TLS Client cert for outgoing requests.

tls_client_key.description: (All) TLS Client key for outgoing requests.

block.description:
* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/datasources/)
* [HTTP API](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/http_api/data_source/)

The required arguments for this resource vary depending on the type of data
source selected (via the 'type' argument).

datasource_id.description: ID of the datasource to apply permissions to.

permission.description: Permission to associate with item. Must be `Query`.

team_id.description: ID of the team to manage permissions for. Defaults to `0`.

user_id.description: ID of the user to manage permissions for. Defaults to `0`.

block.description: The permission items to add/update. Items that are omitted from the list will be removed.

permission.description: Permission to associate with item. Must be one of `View`, `Edit`, or `Admin`.

team_id.description: ID of the team to manage permissions for. Defaults to `0`.

user_id.description: ID of the user to manage permissions for. Defaults to `0`.

block.description: The permission items to add/update. Items that are omitted from the list will be removed.

created.description: Timestamp when the library panel was created.

dashboard_ids.description: Numerical IDs of Grafana dashboards containing the library panel.

folder_id.description: ID of the folder where the library panel is stored.

folder_name.description: Name of the folder containing the library panel.

folder_uid.description: Unique ID (UID) of the folder containing the library panel.

model_json.description: The JSON model for the library panel.

org_id.description: The numeric ID of the library panel computed by Grafana.

panel_id.description: The numeric ID of the library panel computed by Grafana.

type.description: Type of the library panel (eg. text).

uid.description: The unique identifier (UID) of a library panel uniquely identifies library panels between multiple Grafana installs. It’s automatically generated unless you specify it during library panel creation.The UID provides consistent URLs for accessing library panels and when syncing library panels between multiple Grafana installs.

updated.description: Timestamp when the library panel was last modified.

datasource_id.description: The id of the datasource to query.

datasource_type.description: The type of datasource being queried. Currently allowed values are prometheus, graphite, loki, postgres, and datadog.

hyper_params.description: The hyperparameters used to fine tune the algorithm. See https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/machine-learning/models/ for the full list of available hyperparameters. Defaults to `map[]`.

interval.description: The data interval in seconds to train the data on. Defaults to `300`.

metric.description: The metric used to query the job results.

query_params.description: An object representing the query params to query Grafana with.

training_window.description: The data interval in seconds to train the data on. Defaults to `7776000`.

block.description: A job defines the queries and model parameters for a machine learning task.

admin_user.description:
The login name of the configured default admin user for the Grafana
installation. If unset, this value defaults to admin, the Grafana default.
Grafana adds the default admin user to all organizations automatically upon
creation, and this parameter keeps Terraform from removing it from
organizations.
 Defaults to `admin`.

admins.description:
A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given admin
access to the organization. Note: users specified here must already exist in
Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.

create_users.description:
Whether or not to create Grafana users specified in the organization's
membership if they don't already exist in Grafana. If unspecified, this
parameter defaults to true, creating placeholder users with the name, login,
and email set to the email of the user, and a random password. Setting this
option to false will cause an error to be thrown for any users that do not
already exist in Grafana.
 Defaults to `true`.

editors.description:
A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given editor
access to the organization. Note: users specified here must already exist in
Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.

name.description: The display name for the Grafana organization created.

org_id.description: The organization id assigned to this organization by Grafana.

viewers.description:
A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given viewer
access to the organization. Note: users specified here must already exist in
Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.

dashboard_id.description: Dashboard to be sent in the report.

include_dashboard_link.description: Whether to include a link to the dashboard in the report. Defaults to `true`.

include_table_csv.description: Whether to include a CSV file of table panel data. Defaults to `false`.

layout.description: Layout of the report. `simple` or `grid` Defaults to `grid`.

message.description: Message to be sent in the report.

orientation.description: Orientation of the report. `landscape` or `portrait` Defaults to `landscape`.

recipients.description: List of recipients of the report.

reply_to.description: Reply-to email address of the report.

custom_interval.description:
Custom interval of the report.
**Note:** This field is only available when frequency is set to `custom`.

end_time.description: End time of the report. If empty, the report will be sent indefinitely (according to frequency). Note that times will be saved as UTC in Grafana.

frequency.description: Frequency of the report. One of `never`, `once`, `hourly`, `daily`, `weekly`, `monthly` or `custom`.

start_time.description: Start time of the report. If empty, the start date will be set to the creation time. Note that times will be saved as UTC in Grafana.

workdays_only.description: Whether to send the report only on work days. Defaults to `false`.

block.description:
**Note:** This resource is available only with Grafana Enterprise 7.+.

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/enterprise/reporting/)
* [HTTP API](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/http_api/reporting/)

global.description: Boolean to state whether the role is available across all organizations or not. Defaults to `false`.

uid.description: Unique identifier of the role. Used for assignments.

version.description: Version of the role. A role is updated only on version increase.

action.description: Specific action users granted with the role will be allowed to perform (for example: `users:read`)

scope.description: Scope to restrict the action to a set of resources (for example: `users:*` or `roles:customrole1`)

block.description: Specific set of actions granted by the role.

**Note:** This resource is available only with Grafana Enterprise 8.+.

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/enterprise/access-control/)
* [HTTP API](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/http_api/access_control/)

alert_sensitivity.description: Can be set to `none`, `low`, `medium`, or `high` to correspond to the check [alert levels](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/synthetic-monitoring/synthetic-monitoring-alerting/). Defaults to `none`.

basic_metrics_only.description: Metrics are reduced by default. Set this to `false` if you'd like to publish all metrics. We maintain a [full list of metrics](https://github.com/grafana/synthetic-monitoring-agent/tree/main/internal/scraper/testdata) collected for each. Defaults to `true`.

enabled.description: Whether to enable the check. Defaults to `true`.

frequency.description: How often the check runs in milliseconds (the value is not truly a "frequency" but a "period"). The minimum acceptable value is 1 second (1000 ms), and the maximum is 120 seconds (120000 ms). Defaults to `60000`.

labels.description: Custom labels to be included with collected metrics and logs. The maximum number of labels that can be specified per check is 5. These are applied, along with the probe-specific labels, to the outgoing metrics. The names and values of the labels cannot be empty, and the maximum length is 32 bytes.

probes.description: List of probe location IDs where this target will be checked from.

tenant_id.description: The tenant ID of the check.

timeout.description: Specifies the maximum running time for the check in milliseconds. The minimum acceptable value is 1 second (1000 ms), and the maximum 10 seconds (10000 ms). Defaults to `3000`.

ip_version.description: Options are `V4`, `V6`, `Any`. Specifies whether the corresponding check will be performed using IPv4 or IPv6. The `Any` value indicates that IPv6 should be used, falling back to IPv4 if that's not available. Defaults to `V4`.

server.description: DNS server address to target. Defaults to `8.8.8.8`.

valid_r_codes.description: List of valid response codes. Options include `NOERROR`, `BADALG`, `BADMODE`, `BADKEY`, `BADCOOKIE`, `BADNAME`, `BADSIG`, `BADTIME`, `BADTRUNC`, `BADVERS`, `FORMERR`, `NOTIMP`, `NOTAUTH`, `NOTZONE`, `NXDOMAIN`, `NXRRSET`, `REFUSED`, `SERVFAIL`, `YXDOMAIN`, `YXRRSET`.

fail_if_not_matches_regexp.description: Fail if value does not match regex.
Fail if value does not match regex.
Fail if value does not match regex.

block.description: Settings for DNS check. The target must be a valid hostname (or IP address for `PTR` records).

bearer_token.description: Token for use with bearer authorization header.

body.description: The body of the HTTP request used in probe.

cache_busting_query_param_name.description: The name of the query parameter used to prevent the server from using a cached response. Each probe will assign a random value to this parameter each time a request is made.

fail_if_body_matches_regexp.description: List of regexes. If any match the response body, the check will fail.

fail_if_body_not_matches_regexp.description: List of regexes. If any do not match the response body, the check will fail.

fail_if_not_ssl.description: Fail if SSL is not present. Defaults to `false`.

fail_if_ssl.description: Fail if SSL is present. Defaults to `false`.

headers.description: The HTTP headers set for the probe.

ip_version.description: Options are `V4`, `V6`, `Any`. Specifies whether the corresponding check will be performed using IPv4 or IPv6. The `Any` value indicates that IPv6 should be used, falling back to IPv4 if that's not available. Defaults to `V4`.

method.description: Request method. One of `GET`, `CONNECT`, `DELETE`, `HEAD`, `OPTIONS`, `POST`, `PUT`, `TRACE` Defaults to `GET`.

no_follow_redirects.description: Do not follow redirects. Defaults to `false`.

valid_http_versions.description: List of valid HTTP versions. Options include `HTTP/1.0`, `HTTP/1.1`, `HTTP/2`

valid_status_codes.description: Accepted status codes. If unset, defaults to 2xx.

allow_missing.description: Allow header to be missing from responses. Defaults to `false`.

regexp.description: Regex that header value should match.

allow_missing.description: Allow header to be missing from responses. Defaults to `false`.

regexp.description: Regex that header value should match.

block.description: Check fails if headers do not match.

insecure_skip_verify.description: Disable target certificate validation. Defaults to `false`.

server_name.description: Used to verify the hostname for the targets.

block.description: Settings for HTTP check. The target must be a URL (http or https).

dont_fragment.description: Set the DF-bit in the IP-header. Only works with ipV4. Defaults to `false`.

ip_version.description: Options are `V4`, `V6`, `Any`. Specifies whether the corresponding check will be performed using IPv4 or IPv6. The `Any` value indicates that IPv6 should be used, falling back to IPv4 if that's not available. Defaults to `V4`.

block.description: Settings for ping (ICMP) check. The target must be a valid hostname or IP address.

ip_version.description: Options are `V4`, `V6`, `Any`. Specifies whether the corresponding check will be performed using IPv4 or IPv6. The `Any` value indicates that IPv6 should be used, falling back to IPv4 if that's not available. Defaults to `V4`.

tls.description: Whether or not TLS is used when the connection is initiated. Defaults to `false`.

start_tls.description: Upgrade TCP connection to TLS. Defaults to `false`.

block.description: The query sent in the TCP probe and the expected associated response.

insecure_skip_verify.description: Disable target certificate validation. Defaults to `false`.

server_name.description: Used to verify the hostname for the targets.

block.description: Settings for TCP check. The target must be of the form `<host>:<port>`, where the host portion must be a valid hostname or IP address.

max_hops.description: Maximum TTL for the trace Defaults to `64`.

max_unknown_hops.description: Maximum number of hosts to travers that give no response Defaults to `15`.

ptr_lookup.description: Reverse lookup hostnames from IP addresses Defaults to `true`.

block.description: Settings for traceroute check. The target must be a valid hostname or IP address
Check settings. Should contain exactly one nested block.

Synthetic Monitoring checks are tests that run on selected probes at defined
intervals and report metrics and logs back to your Grafana Cloud account. The
target for checks can be a domain name, a server, or a website, depending on
what information you would like to gather about your endpoint. You can define
multiple checks for a single endpoint to check different capabilities.

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/synthetic-monitoring/checks/)

auth_token.description: The probe authentication token. Your probe must use this to authenticate with Grafana Cloud.

labels.description: Custom labels to be included with collected metrics and logs.

public.description: Public probes are run by Grafana Labs and can be used by all users. Only Grafana Labs managed public probes will be set to `true`. Defaults to `false`.

tenant_id.description: The tenant ID of the probe.

block.description:
Besides the public probes run by Grafana Labs, you can also install your
own private probes. These are only accessible to you and only write data to
your Grafana Cloud account. Private probes are instances of the open source
Grafana Synthetic Monitoring Agent.

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/synthetic-monitoring/private-probes/)

email.description: An email address for the team.

members.description:
A set of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given membership
to the team. Note: users specified here must already exist in Grafana.

name.description: The display name for the Grafana team created.

team_id.description: The team id assigned to this team by Grafana.

home_dashboard_id.description: The numeric ID of the dashboard to display when a team member logs in.

theme.description: The theme for the specified team. Available themes are `light`, `dark`, or an empty string for the default theme.

timezone.description: The timezone for the specified team. Available values are `utc`, `browser`, or an empty string for the default.

email.description: The email address of the Grafana user.

is_admin.description: Whether to make user an admin. Defaults to `false`.

login.description: The username for the Grafana user.

name.description: The display name for the Grafana user.

password.description: The password for the Grafana user.

user_id.description: The numerical ID of the Grafana user.

block.description:
* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/manage-users/server-admin/server-admin-manage-users/)
* [HTTP API](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/http_api/user/)

This resource uses Grafana's admin APIs for creating and updating users which
does not currently work with API Tokens. You must use basic auth.

alertmanager_name.description: Name of the Alertmanager instance configured for this stack.

alertmanager_status.description: Status of the Alertmanager instance configured for this stack.

alertmanager_url.description: Base URL of the Alertmanager instance configured for this stack.

alertmanager_user_id.description: User ID of the Alertmanager instance configured for this stack.

id.description: The stack id assigned to this stack by Grafana.

name.description: Name of stack. Conventionally matches the url of the instance (e.g. “<stack_slug>.grafana.net”).

org_id.description: Organization id to assign to this stack.

org_name.description: Organization name to assign to this stack.

org_slug.description: Organization slug to assign to this stack.

prometheus_remote_endpoint.description: Use this URL to query hosted metrics data e.g. Prometheus data source in Grafana

prometheus_remote_write_endpoint.description: Use this URL to send prometheus metrics to Grafana cloud

prometheus_user_id.description: Promehteus user ID. Used for e.g. remote_write.

region_slug.description: The region this stack is deployed to.

slug.description:
Subdomain that the Grafana instance will be available at (i.e. setting slug to “<stack_slug>” will make the instance
available at “https://<stack_slug>.grafana.net".

url.description: Custom URL for the Grafana instance. Must have a CNAME setup to point to `.grafana.net` before creating the stack

dashboard_id.description: The numerical ID of the Grafana dashboard. Specify either this or `uid`. Defaults to `-1`.

folder.description: The numerical ID of the folder where the Grafana dashboard is found.

is_starred.description: Whether or not the Grafana dashboard is starred. Starred Dashboards will show up on your own Home Dashboard by default, and are a convenient way to mark Dashboards that you’re interested in.

title.description: The title of the Grafana dashboard.

uid.description: The uid of the Grafana dashboard. Specify either this or `dashboard_id`. Defaults to ``.

version.description: The numerical version of the Grafana dashboard.

folder_ids.description: Numerical IDs of Grafana folders containing dashboards. Specify to filter for dashboards by folder (eg. `[0]` for General folder), or leave blank to get all dashboards in all folders.

limit.description: Maximum number of dashboard search results to return. Defaults to `5000`.

tags.description: List of string Grafana dashboard tags to search for, eg. `["prod"]`. Used only as search input, i.e., attribute value will remain unchanged.

block.description:
Datasource for retrieving all dashboards. Specify list of folder IDs to search in for dashboards.

* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/dashboards/)
* [Folder/Dashboard Search HTTP API](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/http_api/folder_dashboard_search/)
* [Dashboard HTTP API](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/http_api/dashboard/)

id.description: The numerical ID of the Grafana folder.

title.description: The name of the Grafana folder.

uid.description: The uid of the Grafana folder.

created.description: Timestamp when the library panel was created.

dashboard_ids.description: Numerical IDs of Grafana dashboards containing the library panel.

folder_id.description: ID of the folder where the library panel is stored.

folder_name.description: Name of the folder containing the library panel.

folder_uid.description: Unique ID (UID) of the folder containing the library panel.

model_json.description: The JSON model for the library panel.

org_id.description: The numeric ID of the library panel computed by Grafana.

panel_id.description: The numeric ID of the library panel computed by Grafana.

type.description: Type of the library panel (eg. text).

uid.description: The unique identifier (UID) of a library panel uniquely identifies library panels between multiple Grafana installs. It’s automatically generated unless you specify it during library panel creation.The UID provides consistent URLs for accessing library panels and when syncing library panels between multiple Grafana installs.

updated.description: Timestamp when the library panel was last modified.

block.description: Data source for retrieving a single library panel by name or uid.

labels.description: Custom labels to be included with collected metrics and logs.

public.description: Public probes are run by Grafana Labs and can be used by all users. Only Grafana Labs managed public probes will be set to `true`.

tenant_id.description: The tenant ID of the probe.

block.description: Data source for retrieving a single probe by name.

filter_deprecated.description: If true, only probes that are not deprecated will be returned. Defaults to `true`.

probes.description: Map of probes with their names as keys and IDs as values.

block.description: Data source for retrieving all probes.

email.description: The email address of the Grafana user. Defaults to ``.

is_admin.description: Whether the user is an admin.

login.description: The username for the Grafana user. Defaults to ``.

name.description: The display name for the Grafana user.

user_id.description: The numerical ID of the Grafana user. Defaults to `-1`.

block.description:
* [Official documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/manage-users/server-admin/server-admin-manage-users/)
* [HTTP API](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/http_api/user/)

This data source uses Grafana's admin APIs for reading users which
does not currently work with API Tokens. You must use basic auth.
